wfo-0001029788	general	"Herbs 25-30 cm tall, semierect to erect. Stems up to 6 mm in diameter at base of plant, green to green mottled with purple, unwinged or with straight narrow wings to 0.5 mm, sparsely pubescent; tubers typically borne singly at the end of each stolon.<br/>Sympodial units tri- to plurifoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves odd-pinnate, the blades 7-21 x 5-13 cm, chartaceous, sparsely pubescent adaxially, densely pubescent abaxially; lateral leaflet pairs 3-4, subequal or leaflets increasing in size towards the middle of the leaf and then decreasing gradually toward the leaf base, with the terminal leaflet equal to or slightly larger than the laterals; most distal lateral leaflets 2.4-5.5 x 0.7-2 cm, elliptic-lanceolate to narrow elliptic-lanceolate, the apex slightly acuminate, the base subsessile, symmetrical to more commonly asymmetrical with more tissue on the basiscopic side; terminal leaflet 4-6 x 1.5-2 cm, elliptic-lanceolate, the apex slightly acuminate, the base attenuate, with secondary leaflets on the petiolule absent; interjected leaflets 0-5, sessile, elliptic to orbicular; petioles 1.2-2 cm. Pseudostipules minute to 5 mm long.<br/>Inflorescences terminal with a subtending axillary bud, generally in distal half of the plant, usually forked, with 2-4 flowers, the axes sparsely pubescent; peduncle 3.5-6 cm long; pedicels 12-15 mm long, spaced 1-10 mm apart, articulated in the distal half.<br/>Flowers homostylous, 5-merous. Calyx 4.5-5 mm long, the tube 1-2 mm, the lobes ca. 14 mm, attenuate, the acumens ca. 0.4 mm long, pilose. Corolla 2-2.5 cm in diameter, rotate, light violet, the rays white, the acumens ca. 2 mm long, the corolla edges flat, not folded dorsally, glabrous adaxially, minutely puberulent abaxially, especially along the midribs, ciliate at the margins, especially at the tips of the corollas. Stamens with the filaments 1-2 mm long; anthers 4-5 mm long, lanceolate, connivent, yellow, poricidal at the tips, the pores lengthening to slits with age. Ovary glabrous; style 6.5-7 mm x ca. 1 mm long, glabrous; stigma capitate.<br/>Fruit a long conical berry, ca. 3 cm long, ca. 1.7 cm wide, light green when ripe, glabrous.<br/>Seeds from living specimens ovoid and ca. 2 mm long, whitish to greenish in fresh condition and drying brownish, with a thick covering of “hair-like” lateral walls of the testal cells that make the seeds mucilaginous when wet, green-white throughout; testal cells honeycomb-shaped when lateral walls removed by enzyme digestion."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-neovavilovii		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	ec61d584-57d8-40eb-b4af-449be75cb0e5#general	5f08a8f3-14a9-40e6-b0bc-1e41c6649ba6

wfo-0001027889	general	"Small tree or shrub ca. 1-2.5 m tall. Stems densely glandular- and eglandular-puberulent (-pubescent).<br/>Sympodial units 4-foliate.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades 2-20 x 1-10 cm, ca. 1.5-2 times as long as wide, chartaceous, ovate to elliptic, sparsely to moderately puberulent-pubescent adaxially, moderately to densely puberulent abaxially; base truncate to subcordate with basal lobes up to 1.5 cm; margin entire; apex acute-acuminate; petioles 0.5-11 cm, densely puberulent.<br/>Inflorescences 3-9 cm, unbranched, with 10-30 flowers, all flowers perfect, the axes densely glandular- and eglandular-puberulent; peduncle 0.5-1 cm; rachis 3-8 cm; pedicels 10-12 mm, 10-20 mm in fruit, spaced 1-3 mm apart, articulated above the base, leaving pedicellar remnants 1 mm long.<br/>Buds ovoid, acute at apex. wfo-0001027607	general	"Small shrubs or treelets, 1-4 m tall; young stems slender and zig-zag, densely pubescent with golden, curling, uniseriate trichomes ca. 0.1 mm long; branches arching and flattened, giving the plant a pagoda-like aspect, older plants occasionally with erect branches; bark of older stems glabrate, reddish-brown, not lenticellate.<br/>Sympodial units unifoliate, not geminate except rarely on lower non-reproductive branches.<br/>Leaves elliptic to narrowly elliptic, widest at the middle, 5-10 x 1.5-3 cm, the apex acuminate, the base acute, then decurrent on the petiole; lamina with 5-7 pairs of main lateral veins, glabrous and with the midrib raised above, occasionally a few uniseriate trichomes present on the prominent yellowish veins below; petioles very short, winged, 2-4 mm long.<br/>Inflorescences opposite the leaves, simple, 2-3 mm long, 4-10-flowered, pubescent with uniseriate trichomes like those of the stems; pedicel scars corky and raised, evenly spaced ca. 0.5 mm apart. Buds obovoid, becoming more elongate and ellipsoid with age, the corolla soon exserted from the minute calyx tube. Pedicels at anthesis filiform, 8-9 mm long, tapering gently from the calyx tube to a basal diam. of less than 0.5 mm.<br/>Flowers with the calyx tube only a slight widening of the pedicel, 0.5-1 mm long, the lobes minute, deltoid, 0.25-0.5 mm long, minutely papillose on the tips, or occasionally with a few uniseriate trichomes; corolla white, 0.8-1 cm in diam., lobed 3/4 of the way to the base, the lobes strongly reflexed at anthesis, the tips of the lobes minutely papillose; anthers ca. 2.5 x 1 mm, poricidal at the tips, the pores tear-drop shaped; free portion of the filaments ca. 0.25 mm long, the filament tube narrow, 0.5 mm long; ovary glabrous; style straight, 3-3.5 mm long; stigma a papillose area on the widened tip of the style.<br/>Fruit a globose, green berry, ca. 1 cm in diam.; fruiting pedicels deflexed, slightly woody, 1.2-1.5 cm long, ca. 0.5 mm in diam. at the base.<br/>Seeds tan, dark brown in dry material, ovoid-reniform, 2.5-3 x 2-2.5 mm, the surfaces minutely pitted."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-dissimile		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	a88fc0f0-9712-4b4a-817f-267977dc985f#general	5f713ab8-063f-4e28-9799-4585152df4fa

wfo-0001030000	use	"<p>Peru: asna panga (McDaniel & Rimachi 17800), chupa sacha (Woytkowski 5017), chupo sacha (Bohs & Schunke 2159; Mathias & Taylor 3979; Schunke 1883, 4651, 5866, 6286, 8339); gallinazo panga (Williams 2615, 6762), sihuca sacha (Torres 282), sapohuasca (Quicha; Lewis et al. 11660), tomato del campo (Mexia 8235), yapu iji (Achuar Jívaro; Lewis et al. 12176, 13216).  Brazil: jurubeba (Lemos Froes 20644), tsetsepere (Deni; Prance et al. 16402). </p><br/><p><br/>	Although Plowman & Ramírez (11211) and Mexia (8235) report that the fruits are edible, others say that they are poisonous (Fosberg 28993).  The juice of the leaves and stems is used as an analgesic and sedative for intestinal fever, headaches, rheumatism, kidney ailments, hangovers, muscle aches, and pains of the lower back and stomach (Bohs & Schunke 2159; Mathias & Taylor 3979; Plowman & Schunke 7513; Plowman & Ramírez 11211; Schunke 5866, 6286, 8339; Woytkowski 5017).  The label of Plowman & Schunke 7513 gives a more detailed account of the medicinal preparation of this species.  The leaf is rasped in cold water, lemon juice is added, and the infusion is taken in the morning before breakfast for three days.  Schunke 5866 reports that an infusion is given in an enema to combat the grippe.  Data from Lewis et al. 11660 indicate that the Quichuas of Loreto, Peru, drink an infusion of the crushed leaves to cure malaria.  The Achuar Jívaro of Amazonian Peru scrape the bark into a cold infusion that is used to massage swollen body parts (Lewis et al. 12176).  A poultice of the leaves is also used to massage the skin around a snake bite (Lewis et al. 13236).  In Amazonian Brazil, the leaves are heated in water and used to bathe babies, both to keep them healthy and to cure fever (Prance et al. 16402).</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-obliquum-0		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Use	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	0b4447d2-cdbf-4bc2-8287-298b317a8d86#use	5fc4cf11-1452-42f6-909a-8199dd50f716

wfo-0001027104	general	"Herbaceous tuber-bearing perennials 0.15-0.35 m tall, terrestrial, but growing in epiphytic-like conditions in moss, or more rarely epiphytic. Stems 2-3 mm in diameter at base of plant.<br/>Sympodial units typically 3-6-foliate.<br/>Pseudostipules to 5-15 mm long, linear to narrowly ovate. Leaves odd-pinnate, 2-6 cm long, 1.5-4.2 cm wide, simple, ovate, apex acute to acuminate, base cordate to truncate or attenuate, finely pubescent adaxially and abaxially; petioles 1-3 cm long.<br/>Inflorescence a dichasially branched, ebracteate, monochasial or dichasial cyme, 2-3 forked, generally in the distal half of the plant, with 4-15 flowers, all flowers perfect, peduncle 1.2-6 cm long; pedicels 10-15 mm long, articulate between the proximal ¼ and the distal ¼.<br/>Flowers with the calyx 2.2-5 mm long, lobes acute to mucronate, acumens 1-1.5 mm long. Anthers 3-5.5 mm long, connate, yellow, apically poricidally dehiscent and often maturing to a short introrse apical slit, filaments 1-4 mm long. Ovary with style 6-7.5 mm long, exceeding stamens by 2-3 mm, straight, with stigma globose.<br/>Fruits 0.5-0.8 cm in diameter, globose, yellow-green to green throughout.<br/>Seeds from living specimens green-white throughout, ovoid, ca. 2 mm long, with a thick covering of “hair-like” lateral walls of the testal cells that make the seeds mucilaginous when wet. wfo-0001026453	general	"Shrubs or small trees to 4m, usually smaller, armed or unarmed; stems if armed with sparse to dense straight prickles to 1 cm long on all internodes, these usually reddish, sometimes broad based and shorter with a basal diameter to ca. 3.5 mm, pubescence of sessile porrect stellate trichomes to 0.5 mm in diameter with 6-8 rays, the midpoints usually shorter than the rays, often absent; new growth densely stellate pubescent, the trichomes like those of the stems; bark of older stems brown, glabrescent, grayish brown on trunks. <br/>Sympodial units 2 to plurifoliate.<br/>Leaves simple, 1.9-21.3 x 0.45-5.5 cm, narrowly elliptic to linear, occasionally elliptic, both surfaces sometimes armed with straight, orange prickles along the midrib and occasionally the primary veins, the upper surface almost glabrous with a few scattered sessile porrect stellate trichomes ca. 0.5 mm in diameter with 6-8 rays and the midpoints equal in length to the rays on the veins and lamina to evenly pubescent with sessile porrect stellate trichomes, the lamina easily visible, the lower surface more densely pubescent, the trichomes like those of the upper surfaces; primary veins 5-32 pairs, more or less parallel and easily visible both above and beneath; the base attenuate, sometimes oblique, occasionally rounded; margins entire, very occasionally shallowly lobed (e.g., <i>Howard 6376</i>); the apex acute to acuminate; petioles 0.1-2.7 cm, sparsely to densely pubescent with sessile porrect stellate trichomes to ca. 0.5 mm in diameter, these denser on the adaxial surface.<br/>Inflorescences lateral, sometimes opposite the leaves, to 15 cm long, usually simple, but occasionally branched (aberrant), with 30 or more flowers but with only 1 or 2 open at a time, sparsely pubescent to pubescent with sessile porrect stellate trichomes like those of the stems, the midpoints equal to or shorter than the rays; peduncle 1-2 cm, unarmed; pedicels 0.8-1.1 cm, ca. 0.5 mm in diameter, filiform, spreading and the flowers usually deflexed to one side of the inflorescence and the pedicels bent at the base, pubescence of sessile porrect stellate trichomes like that of the rest of the inflorescence, but usually sparser, articulated at the base; pedicel scars evenly spaced in pairs, ca. 5 mm apart at the base of the inflorescence, ca. 1 mm apart more distally. Buds thin and tapering, the corolla strongly exserted from the calyx tube before anthesis.<br/>Flowers all perfect; calyx tube 0.5-1 mm, conical, the lobes 1-1.5 mm, triangular to deltate-triangular, irregularly pubescent with sessile porrect stellate trichomes to 0.5 mm in diameter, the midpoint sorter than or equal to the rays, often denser than pubescence of the pedicel; corolla 1.5-2 cm in diameter, violet or white, narrowly stellate, lobed nearly to the base, the lobes 6-10 x 1-1.5 mm, glabrous or with a few weak stellate trichomes on the midvein adaxially, densely pubescent abaxially, the trichomes porrect stellate to 0.5 mm in diameter; anthers 5.5-8 x ca. 1 mm, strongly tapering, poricidal at the tips, the pores not lengthening to slits, directed distally, the anther tube densely stellate pubescent within, the trichomes weak and tangled, enmeshing the style; filament tube < 0.5 mm, the free portion of the filaments < 0.5 mm, glabrous; style 7-9 mm, glabrous, only just exceeding the anthers; stigma minutely capitate, the surface minutely papillose.<br/>Fruit a globose berry, 0.5-0.7 cm in diameter, bright red at maturity, the pericarp thin and shiny, glabrous; fruiting pedicels 1-1.2 cm, ca. 1 mm in diameter, slightly enlarged at the apex, bent at the base so the berries all hanging from one side of the inflorescence axis.<br/>Seeds 10-20 per berry, 2-2.5 x 1-1.5 mm, flattened reniform, pale tan or yellowish brown, the surfaces minutely pitted, the testal cells somewhat sinuate in outline."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-bahamense		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	c02d616f-dc96-4b5a-85f6-b5ef3af8685f#general	60a36a84-e36e-4def-bd24-8c14f14f440e

wfo-0001029546	general	"Herbs 0.3-1 m tall, erect or decumbent. Stems 4-10 mm in diameter at base of plant, unwinged or with straight to curved wings up to 5 mm wide, often densely covered with simple, short, brownish, and soft non-glandular trichomes and often with longer glandular trichomes, frequently with whitish dots, green to purple or green and purple mottled.<br/>Sympodial units tri- to plurifoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves simple to odd-pinnate, the blades 8-19.5 x 4.5-12.5 cm, green, membranous to chartaceous, densely pubescent adaxially and abaxially, with hairs like those of the stems; lateral leaflet pairs 0-2, greatly subequal and decreasing in size to the leaf base, most distal lateral leaflets 1.6-6.5 x 1-3.2 cm, broadly ovate to broadly elliptic, sometimes nearly orbicular, the apex acute to acuminate, the base regular to oblique, cordate to elliptical, sessile and decurrent or with petiolules up to 8 mm long; terminal leaflet 6.3-19.5 x 2-9 cm, broadly ovate broadly to elliptical, sometimes nearly orbicular, the apex acute to acuminate, the base slightly cordate to truncate to long attenuate, sometimes to the base; interjected leaflets typically absent; petioles 1-4.5 cm long, often densely covered with simple, short, brownish, and soft non-glandular trichomes and often with longer glandular trichomes, frequently with whitish dots. Pseudostipules 5-10 mm long, lunate, with hairs like those of the stem.<br/>Inflorescences 4-10 cm, terminal with a subtending axillary bud, generally in distal half of the plant, usually forked, with 5-18 flowers, with all flowers apparently perfect, the axes often densely pubescent with hairs like those of the stem; peduncle 1.5-6.2 cm long; rachis 3-8 cm long; pedicels 8-17 mm long in flower and fruit, spaced 1-10 mm apart, articulated at about the middle.<br/>Flowers homostylous, 5-merous. Calyx 4.5-7 mm long, the tube 1-2 mm, the lobes 3.5-5 mm long, apiculate to long attenuate, the acumens 1-5 mm long, with hairs like the stem, Corolla 2.2-2.8 cm in diameter, pentagonal to rotate-pentagonal, white (very rarely white tinged with blue), the tube 1-2 mm long, the acumens 2-4 mm long, the corolla edges flat, not folded dorsally, glabrous abaxially, minutely pubescent adaxially. Stamens with the filaments 1-2 mm long; anthers 5-8 mm long, lanceolate, connivent, yellow, poricidal at the tips, the pores lengthening to slits with age. Ovary glabrous; style 7-10 x ca. 1 mm, exceeding stamens by 2-4 mm, straight, glabrous; stigma clavate to capitate.<br/>Fruit a globose to slightly ovoid berry, 1.5-2 cm in diameter, green when ripe, glabrous.<br/>Seeds from living specimens ovoid and ca. 2 mm long, whitish to greenish in fresh condition and drying brownish, with a thick covering of “hair-like” lateral walls of the testal cells that make the seeds mucilaginous when wet, green-white throughout; testal cells honeycomb-shaped when lateral walls removed by enzyme digestion."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-microdontum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	9a7378e6-25fc-4be9-b31a-c25c0e66d30c#general	60d26b36-33cc-466f-936e-ec3e16c45411

wfo-0001029680	general	"Annual, erect or prostrate herb up to 50 cm tall. Stems fleshy, becoming woody, up to 12 mm in diameter at the base, glabrous or rarely sparsely pubescent with simple, uniseriate, multicellular hairs up to 0.6 mm long.<br/>Sympodial units difoliate or rarely plurifoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves pinnate, bipinnate or rarely tripinnate, fleshy, the blades 4.0–16 (–19) x 1.4–7.5 cm, 1.6–2.7 (–3.2) times as long as wide, usually with a narrow wing 1–6 mm wide along the midrib between the primary pinnae, glabrous adaxially and abaxially or rarely sparsely to moderately pubescent adaxially and abaxially with simple, uniseriate, multicellular hairs up to 1 mm long (Arequipa and Tacna specimens only); base decurrent on a winged petiole, the wing up to 10 mm wide and extending beyond the leaf node and forming a flange running parallel to the stem; margin divided into 3–6 pairs of primary pinnae, the primary pinnae 4–30 (–48) x 3–22 (–46) mm, usually asymmetrically arranged each side of the midrib, decreasing in size from base of leaf to the apex, primary pinnae divided further into 1–3 secondary and occasionally tertiary pinnae irregularly spaced along each side, secondary and tertiary pinnae 2–20 x 1–8 mm; apex of all pinnae acute to obtuse; petioles indistinct, winged.<br/>Inflorescences 4.5–20 cm long, borne on terminal and axillary shoots, branched 1–2 (–3) times, with 8–32 flowers, all flowers perfect, the axes subglabrous to moderately pubescent, the hairs often appressed, simple, uniseriate, unicellular or multicellular, up to 1.5 mm long; peduncle 1.7–7 (–12.5) cm long; pedicels 5–11 mm at anthesis, 11–25 mm in fruit, spaced 4–10 mm apart in fruit, articulated at the base.<br/>Flowers with the calyx 3.3–5.5 mm long, the tube 0.6–2.0 mm, the lobes equal, 1.8–3.8 x 0.5–1.5 mm at anthesis, 2.2–4.2 x 1.0–1.8 mm in fruit, oblong, becoming ovate in fruit, the apex obtuse, glabrous adaxially and abaxially or rarely sparsely pubescent abaxially with simple, uniseriate, multicellular hairs up to 0.4 mm long. wfo-0001030430	general	"Perennial, erect shrub 30–200 cm tall. Stems pale brown, brittle, woody, glabrous to moderately pubescent with simple, uniseriate, multicellular hairs up to 0.25 mm long.<br/>Sympodial units unifoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves simple, fleshy, the blades 1.3–8.0 x 0.8–5.6 cm, 1.2–2.0 (–2.7) times as long as wide, subglabrous to moderately or occasionally densely pubescent adaxially and abaxially with simple uniseriate, multicellular hairs up to 0.5 mm long; base decurrent; margin regularly lobed with 3–5 pairs of lobes, the lobes 3–24 x 1–9 mm, 1.8–5.0 times as long as wide, dentate or serrate, elliptic to ovate, the basal and apical sides of the lobes convex; the lobe apex acute to rounded; petioles 0–20 mm, with indumentum as that of leaf blades.<br/>Inflorescences 3–17 cm long, borne on terminal and axillary shoots, branched 2–3 times, with 12–30 (–40) flowers, all flowers perfect, the axes subglabrous to densely pubescent with appressed, simple, uniseriate, multicellular hairs up to 0.6 mm long; peduncle 0.5–12 cm; pedicels 3–8 mm at anthesis, 5–10 mm in fruit, spaced 3–5 mm apart in fruit, articulated at the base.<br/>Flowers with the calyx 3–5 mm long, the tube 0.8–3.0 mm, the lobes equal, 2.0–4.2 x 0.6–1.0 mm at anthesis, 2.0–3.0 x 1.5–1.7 mm in fruit, elliptic to ovate, the apex acute to rounded, subglabrous to densely pubescent adaxially and abaxially with simple, uniseriate, multicellular hairs up to 0.3 mm long. Corolla 12–20 mm in diameter, pentagonal, chartaceous, white, violet, purple or blue, the tube 1–3 mm long, the lobes 6–10 x 5.5–12 mm, moderately to densely pubescent abaxially, especially in bud and towards the lobe apices, the hairs simple, uniseriate, multicellular, up to 0.4 mm long, glabrous adaxially. Stamens 5, equal; filament tube 1.0–1.2 mm, glabrous; filaments equal, 1.0–2.0 mm long, glabrous; anthers equal, 3.0–4.5 x 1.0–1.5 mm, oblong, yellow, not connivent, poricidal at the tips, the pores tear-drop shaped and opening into longitudinal slits with age. Ovary glabrous; style 5–6 x ca. 0.2 mm, cylindrical, straight, glabrous; stigma capitate or clavate, 0.9–1.0 x 0.6–0.8 mm.<br/>Fruit 3–4 mm in diameter, globose, glabrous, green, few-seeded, stones cells present, abundant, rounded, ca. 0.5 mm diameter.<br/>Seeds 1.4–1.5 x 1.6–1.8 mm, flattened, pale brown, glabrous, the surface shallowly pitted."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-pinnatum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	d57c9d05-6eda-480d-85f9-8f59be246830#general	627e6d3b-4bbd-4c42-b9b1-1abaed6638be

wfo-0001027606	general	"Erect, rhizomatous perennial shrub, 0.3-0.8 m tall. Stems grey or brown, glabrous; finger hairs absent; very short, gland-tipped hairs absent; prickles straight, acicular, 7-10 mm long, ca.<i> </i>7 prickles per dm on juvenile branches, 4-11 mm long, 9-13 times longer than wide, 3-10 per dm on adult branches. <br/>Sympodial units apparently 2- to 3-foliate, usually geminate.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades 2-7 x 0.2-4 cm, chartaceous, the juvenile leaves with blades 5.5-7 x 3-4 cm, ovate, deeply lobed, with 2-5 pairs of lobes, with 2-3 prickles on upper surface, the adult leaves with blades 2-5.5 x 0.2-2.5 cm, 1.5-2.9 (-10) times as long as wide, ovate or broadly ovate, green and glabrous adaxially; finger hairs absent; very short, gland-tipped hairs present only in vein depressions; prickles absent or present on midvein only, 0-4, straight, acicular, 1-7 mm long; green and glabrous abaxially; finger hairs absent; very short, gland-tipped hairs absent; prickles absent or present on midvein only, 0-4, straight, acicular; base cuneate or obtuse, the oblique part 0-1.5 mm long; margin entire or deeply lobed throughout, the lobes 2-4 on each side, acute or obtuse, lobing index 7-22; apex acute or obtuse; petioles 0.3-1.2 cm long, 12-25% length of lamina, glabrous, prickles present or absent.<br/>Inflorescence 1-2 cm long, extra-axillary, unbranched or occasionally branched, pseudo-racemose, with 2-5 flowers, all flowers perfect, the axes glabrous, unarmed; peduncle 0-0.2 cm; rachis 0.5-1 cm; pedicels 6-8 mm long in flower, 0.4-0.5 mm thick at midpoint, markedly thicker distally, 10-19 mm long in fruit, 0.5-1 mm thick at mid-point, spaced 1-5 mm apart, articulated at the base.<br/>Flowers all perfect, 5-merous. wfo-0001027770	distribution	"<p>Native to the Americas, with an amphitropical distribution, occurring in the deserts and dry zones of the northern hemisphere in the southwestern United States and Mexico and in the southern in Argentina and Chile, but widespread and invasive in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide. It is toxic to livestock and very hard to control, as rootstocks less than 1 cm long can regenerate into plants (Invasive Species South Africa 2012). Introduced and invasive in drier habitats in southern (South Africa and Namibia) and northern (Morocco and Egypt) Africa, in South Africa classified as a noxious weed (Henderson 2011; Invasive Species South Africa 2012) and a quarantine pest in northern Africa (OEPP/EPPO 2007); also known from dry areas around the Mediterranean.</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-elaeagnifolium		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	e542181c-fc60-4361-bf74-15858ae23dfd#distribution	653efbb7-a649-4a09-823a-ff7fbf000947
wfo-0001027770	general	"Herbaceous, woody at base, 20 to 50 cm tall, erect, from underground horizontal stems (stolons), sparsely or densely armed, sometimes unarmed. Young stems terete, densely stellate-pubescent, prickly or unarmed; trichomes stellate, sessile to subsessile, porrect, the stalk 0.1-0.15 mm long, the rays 10-14(16), 0.1-0.3 mm long, the midpoints 0.1-0.15 mm long, sometimes reduced; prickles, if present, usually uniform throughout the plant, 2-6 mm long if dense, 0.3-2 mm long if sparse, 0.5-2 mm wide at base, usually straight, orange to red; bark of older stems smooth, brown to gray, the leaf scars small brown stumps. <br/>Sympodial units difoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades (1.5)3-6(12) cm long, (0.3)1-2(3) cm wide, (2)3-4(6) times longer than wide, narrowly elliptic, sometimes lanceolate or narrowly ovate, mostly concolorous, drying yellow-green or white-green, rarely dark green, densely pubescent on both surfaces with sessile to subsessile stellate trichomes, the rays (9)12-14, 0.1-0.3 mm long, porrect, the midpoint up to 0.15 mm long, sometimes reduced; primary veins 4-7 pairs, raised adaxially, flat abaxially, spreading at ca. 30-45° to the midvein, the tertiary venation mostly not visible to the naked eye; base obtuse to rounded or cuneate, often oblique; margins entire to shallowly lobed, the lobes 4 to 6 on each side, extending up to ½ of the distance to the midvein, up to 2(4) cm long, rounded to deltate; apex obtuse to rounded, rarely acute; petiole 0.2-2(4) cm, 1/2-1/6 of the leaf length, densely stellate-pubescent like the young stems. <br/>Inflorescences apparently terminal or lateral, (2)3-5(6) cm long, with (3)4-6(7) flowers, not branching, densely pubescent with stellate trichomes like the stems; peduncle 0.8-2.5 cm long; pedicels 1-3 cm long, ca. 1 mm in diameter, filiform or apically dilated, densely stellate-pubescent like the young stems, usually armed, articulated less than 0.5 mm from the base; pedicel scars prominent brown stumps spaced 0.5-1 mm apart, sometimes obscured by the pubescence. <br/>Flowers 5-merous, almost all perfect, rarely some flowers short-styled and staminate. Calyx 4-8 mm long, densely stellate-pubescent like the leaf blades, sparsely prickly or unarmed, the prickles to 2 mm long, spaced 0.5-2 mm apart, the lobes 2- 4 mm long, 1-2 mm wide at base, cuspidate, the venation not visible. Corolla 2.5-3(4) cm in diameter, pale violet or white, stellate, lobed ca. ½ way to the base, the lobes 6-10(12) mm long, 6-10 mm wide, deltate, reflexed at anthesis, often with a yellow midvein, stellate-pubescent abaxially, mostly glabrous adaxially, the stellate trichomes variously irregular and reduced-multangulate. Stamens equal, the filament tube 0.8-1.5 mm, the free portion of the filaments 1-2 mm long, glabrous; anthers 6-10 mm long, 1.5-2 mm wide, tapering, spreading, the surfaces often papillate, poricidal at the tips, the pores lengthening with age. Ovary globose to ovoid, usually densely stellate-pubescent like the young stem, sometimes glabrous; style 7-15 mm long, glabrous, slightly dilated toward the apex, in rare short-styled flowers 2-4 mm long; stigma clavate, papillose. <br/>Fruit a spherical berry, 1-5 per infructescence, 0.6-1.2 cm in diameter, the pericarp thin, smooth, glabrous, yellow to dark orange at maturity, drying orange to brown; fruiting pedicels 1-2.5 cm long, 0.5-1(2) mm in diameter at the base, 1-2(3) mm in diameter at the apex, somewhat woody, erect to pendulous, usually armed; fruiting calyx lobes not markedly elongating, reflexed or up to 2/3 the length of the mature fruit, with prickles ca. 2 mm long. <br/>Seeds ca. 15-30 per berry, 2-3 mm long, 2-3 mm wide, flattened reniform, orange-brown."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-elaeagnifolium		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	e542181c-fc60-4361-bf74-15858ae23dfd#general	653efbb7-a649-4a09-823a-ff7fbf000947

wfo-0001030153	distribution	"<p>In the Brazilian states of Santa Catarina, Paraná and Rio Grande do Sul, in Atlantic forests and forest margins, from 600-1300 m.</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-pabstii		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	bf88f3c0-7b98-467f-978b-6a702b2d0f4a#distribution	658dd382-a2c9-4d47-a5f1-f855fd2da0fe
wfo-0001030153	general	"Treelets or small trees 3-5 m; stems erect, glabrous; bark dark on young stems, yellowish on older stems; new growth glabrous or occasionally minutely papillate.<br/>Sympodial units plurifoliate.<br/>Leaves simple, 3.5-10.5 x 1-2.5 cm, narrowly elliptic to lanceolate, glabrous adaxially, the vein axils with resinous dots, glabrous and with distinct pit-like domatia in the vein axils abaxially, the base acute to attenuate, the margins entire, slightly revolute, the apex acute to acuminate; primary veins 6-8 pairs, impressed above; petioles 0.2-1 cm, glabrous.<br/>Inflorescences internodal to apparently terminal, 2-8 cm, 3-4 times branched, with 3-50 flowers, glabrous, thin and brittle in dry specimens, the peduncle 1-2 cm; pedicels 1.3-1.5 cm, ca. 0.1 mm in diameter at the base, ca. 0.2 mm in diameter at the apex, glabrous, more or less nodding at anthesis; pedicel scars irregularly spaced 1-10 mm apart, plane with the rachis. Buds narrowly ellipsoid, the corolla strongly exerted from the calyx.<br/>Flowers all perfect; calyx tube 1.5-2 mm, conical, the lobes 1-1.2 mm, deltate, apiculate, the margins membranous and paler, glabrous; corolla 1.3-1.9 cm in diameter, white, lobed ca. 2/3 of the way to the base, the lobes 0.8-1.3 cm, broadly deltate, campanulate at anthesis, the tips densely papillate; filaments with the free portion 1-2 mm, the tube absent, glabrous; anthers 2.5-4 x 1-1.5 mm, poricidal at the tips, the pores lengthening to slits with age; ovary glabrous, conical, the style 5-6 mm, straight, glabrous, the stigma clavate to slightly 2-lobed, the surface minutely papillate.<br/>Fruit a globose berry, 0.8-0.9 cm in diameter, green when ripe; fruiting pedicels ca. 2 cm, not markedly enlarged at the apex.<br/>Not known."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-pabstii		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	bf88f3c0-7b98-467f-978b-6a702b2d0f4a#general	658dd382-a2c9-4d47-a5f1-f855fd2da0fe
wfo-0001030941	distribution	"<p><i>Solanum rugosum</i> is common in Central America and the West Indies in moist coastal lowlands and montane rain forests, and in South America in coastal regions and the lowlands of the Amazon basin in roadside thickets, forest clearings and along river banks, at elevations from sea level to 1000 to 1300 m in the Andean foothills of Colombia and Venezuela.</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-rugosum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	da0250c3-643d-460a-b050-bd71ff54b639#distribution	65c8bbe7-8c99-4d80-8ffa-cd62f29e78b3
wfo-0001030941	general	"Shrubs or small trees 1-9 m high, unarmed. Trunks to 10 cm in diameter; bark of older stems pale gray to brown, the young branches terete, scabrous or scabridulous, glabrescent, the hairs sparse to moderately dense, mostly sessile and some short-stalked, porrect-stellate and rarely multangulate, the stalks multiseriate, 0.02-0.4 x 0.04-0.08 mm, the rays 6-9, 0.08-0.35 mm long, the midpoints 0.02-0.3 mm.<br/>Sympodial units plurifoliate, axillary leaves absent.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades usually 10-25 x 3.5-10 cm, ca. 2-4 times as long as wide, narrowly obovate or elliptic, chartaceous, scabrous adaxially, the hairs sparse, rarely touching, sessile, porrect-stellate, the rays 4-9, 0.07-0.4 mm long, the midpoints 0.08-0.5 mm long, moderately pubescent abaxially, the hairs mostly sessile and occasionally short-stalked, porrect-stellate, the stalks multiseriate, 0.02-0.25 x 0.02-0.06 mm, the rays 4-12, 0.04-0.5 mm long, the midpoints 0.02-0.3 mm; unarmed; main lateral veins 7-10 on each side of midvein; base long-attenuate, decurrent along entire length of petiole or nearly so; margin entire; apex short to long acuminate; petioles ca. 0.2-0.8(-1.5) cm, ca. 1/50-1/15 the length of the blades, scabrous or scabridulous, the hairs mostly sessile and occasionally short-stalked, porrect-stellate.<br/>Inflorescences 7-23 cm, terminal, becoming lateral due to continued growth of stem, ca. 3-6 times branched, with ca. 20-100 flowers, the axes unarmed, scabrous, the hairs mostly sessile and some short-stalked, porrect-stellate and rarely multangulate, the stalks multiseriate, ca. 0.03-0.25 x 0.03-0.06 mm, the rays 5-9, ca. 0.04-0.4 mm long, the midpoints ca. 0.01-0.3 mm; peduncle 6-22 cm, 1.5-4.5 mm thick; rachis 0.5-1.5 cm; pedicels 2-5 mm in flower, up to 9 mm in fruit, spaced ca. 0.5-5 mm apart, articulated at the base, moderately pubescent, sometimes glabrescent and stipitate-glandular at apex, the hairs sessile and sometimes short-stalked, mostly porrect-stellate and occasionally multangulate.<br/>Flower buds 3-5 mm long at anthesis, nearly globose or somewhat ellipsoid; corolla appressed-tomentose in bud, the hairs mostly sessile, porrect-stellate; calyx tomentose, the hairs mostly sessile, porrect-stellate and rarely multangulate; calyx lobe sutures obscured by tomentum. Flowers all apparently perfect, 5-merous. Calyx 3-4.5 mm long, lobed 1/3-1/2 way to the base, campanulate, subcoriaceous, the tube 1.3-2.5 mm, the lobes 1.1-2.8 x 1.2-2.2 mm in flower, triangular and acute or occasionally obtuse, moderately to densely pubescent abaxially, the tube often stipitate-glandular and less densely pubescent to glabrescent and darker in color than the lobes, the hairs mostly sessile and some short-stalked, mostly porrect-stellate and rarely multangulate, the stalks multiseriate, 0.04-0.35 x 0.03-0.05 mm, the rays 4-12, ca. 0.04-0.22 mm long, the midpoints 0.01-0.22 mm, glabrous to rather densely pubescent on lobes adaxially, the hairs sessile, mostly porrect-stellate and occasionally multangulate, the rays 4-8, ca. 0.04-0.1 mm long; fruiting calyx somewhat accrescent, the lobes 1.3-4.5 x 1.4-3.5 mm. Corolla 1.4-1.6 cm in diameter, 6-10 mm long, weakly to rather strongly exserted from calyx at anthesis, stelliform, white, the tube 1.5-3.5 mm, the lobes 4-8 x 2-3.3 mm, lanceolate to ovate, acute at apices, moderately pubescent to tomentose on lobes abaxially, the hairs mixed sessile and short-stalked, mostly porrect-stellate and occasionally multangulate, the stalks 0.04-0.1 x 0.02-0.04 mm, the rays 5-9, 0.06-0.42 mm, the midpoints 0.06-0.35 mm, glabrous or sparsely pubescent toward apices adaxially, the hairs sessile, porrect-stellate and multangulate, rays 4-8, ca. 0.04-0.12 mm long. Stamens with filaments 1-1.4 mm long, inserted on corolla tube 1.1-1.3 mm above the base, glabrous; anthers 2-3.2 x 0.8-1.3 mm, oblong, blunt-tipped, yellow, free, glabrous, dehiscing by large introrse apical-lateral pores that extend into longitudinal slits with age. Ovary conical to ovoidal, glabrous or moderately pubescent, the hairs sessile and some short-stalked, mostly multangulate and sometimes simple, stipitate-glandular, the stalks 0.02-0.06 x 0.02-0.04 mm, often glandular, the rays ca. 2-16, 0.03-0.6 mm long, the longer rays directed toward apex; style 4-6 x 0.1-0.3 mm, terete, exserted from stamens, glabrous or sparsely pubescent up to 3/4 from the base, the hairs sessile, few-rayed multangulate; stigma subcapitate.<br/>Fruit a fleshy berry, 0.8 -1.1 cm in diameter, globose, obtuse at apex, yellow when ripe, glabrescent or sparingly pubescent, occasionally stipitate-glandular, the hairs sessile and thick-stalked, multangulate, the stalks 0.04-0.1 x 0.04-0.08, the rays ca. 2-16, 0.04-0.6 mm long.<br/>Seeds 1.2-2.1 x 1.1-1.7 mm, mostly subreniform, deltoid or suborbicular, yellowish brown, the testa minutely honeycombed, reticulate-punctate."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-rugosum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	da0250c3-643d-460a-b050-bd71ff54b639#general	65c8bbe7-8c99-4d80-8ffa-cd62f29e78b3

wfo-0001025825	general	"Herbs 0.4-1 m tall, erect. Stems 3-5 mm in diameter at base of plant, winged or unwinged, the wings 0-0.21 mm wide, glabrous.<br/>Sympodial units tri- to plurifoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves odd-pinnate, the blades 10.5-26 x 6.6-14 cm, light green abaxially and dark green adaxially, coriaceous and shiny, glabrous adaxially, glabrous to glabrescent with very short hairs abaxially; lateral leaflet pairs 5-7, increasing in size toward the middle of leaf and then decreasing toward the leaf base, with the terminal leaflet generally subequal or smaller to the laterals; most distal lateral leaflets 3-8.5 x 0.7-2.2 cm, elliptic, the apex acute to acuminate, the base petiolulate or sessile and slightly decurrent on the rachis, attenuate to rounded, asymmetric with more tissue on the basiscopic side; terminal leaflet 3.7-6.5 x 0.9-2 cm, elliptic, the apex acute to acuminate, the base cuneate; interjected leaflets 14-85, sessile to short petiolulate, ovate to orbicular; petioles 1-5.5 cm, glabrous. Pseudostipules 3-5 mm long, glabrous to subglabrous.<br/>Inflorescences 6-10 cm, terminal with a subtending axillary bud, generally in distal half of the plant, usually forked, with 22-86 flowers, with all flowers apparently perfect, the axes glabrous; peduncle 0.5-10.4 cm long; pedicels 10-24 mm long in flower and fruit, spaced 5-10 mm apart, articulated high in the distal half.<br/>Flowers homostylous, 5-merous. Calyx 4-9 mm long, the tube 1-3 mm, the lobes 2-5 mm, ovate to lanceolate, the acumens 0.4-3 mm long, glabrous. Corolla 2-3.7 cm in diameter, pentagonal to rotate-pentagonal, white with a lilac streak on the back of the lobes, the tube 1-2 mm long, the acumens 0.5-0.8 mm long, the corolla edges flat, slightly folded dorsally, glabrous abaxially and adaxially. Stamens with the filaments 1-2 mm long; anthers 4-8 mm long, lanceolate, connivent, yellow, poricidal at the tips, the pores lengthening to slits with age. Ovary glabrous; style 3-10 mm x ca. 1 mm, exceeding stamens by 0.9-4 mm, straight, glabrous; stigma clavate to capitate.<br/>Fruit an ovoid berry, 1.1-1.4 cm in diameter, medium green, glabrous.<br/>Seeds from living specimens ovoid and ca. 2 mm long, whitish to greenish in fresh condition and drying brownish, with a thick covering of “hair-like” lateral walls of the testal cells that make the seeds mucilaginous when wet, green-white throughout; testal cells honeycomb-shaped when lateral walls removed by enzyme digestion."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-albornozii		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	60632f53-8478-47f1-b54f-91d03fbad83c#general	66455ec1-bfde-40d6-b5e5-a7dd99663dde
wfo-0001025737	distribution	"<p>Known from brushy areas, roadsides, pastures, fallow fields, sandy river banks and other open areas nearly throughout the lowlands of Bolivia north of the chaco vegetation, and in adjacent Rondônia, Brazil, and rarely eastwards to the state of Pará. wfo-0001025737	general	"Shrubs 1.5–3 (–4) m high, the stem to 10 cm in diameter, the internodes 3–10 cm long. Stems densely stellate-tomentose, mixed short- and long-stipitate porrect stellae in the southern part of the range and more appressed-tomentose with very short-stipitate stellae in the northern part of the range, 0.3–0.7 mm wide, the stipes to 0.6 mm long, the rays 8–10, 0.2–0.3 mm long, the midpoint shorter; prickles absent or few to 3 mm long, broad-based, straight .<br/>Sympodia difoliate, geminate.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades 8–16 (–20) × 4–11 (–14) cm, 1.5–2 times as long as wide, ovate to ovate-lanceolate, thick-chartaceous, greenish and persistently densely stellate-tomentose adaxially, more loosely tomentose and lighter-colored abaxially, the stellae of both surfaces short-stipitate in the southern part of the range, sessile adaxially in the northern part of the range, the blade unarmed except for the most vigorous juvenile growth with straight prickles to 5 mm long on the major veins of both surfaces; principal lateral veins 4–6 on each side of the midvein; base obtuse to rounded or angularly-cordate; margin usually entire on fertile branches, or shallowly lobed with 2–3 lobes per side, the lobes acute to attenuate; apex attenuate; petioles 1.5–5 cm long, densely stellate-tomentose like the stem, unarmed or more rarely sparsely armed with prickles like those of the stem.<br/>Inflorescences 2.5–4.5 cm in flower, up to 3.5–8 cm in fruit, extra-axillary, lateral, (1–) 2 (–3)-branched, with 25–50 flowers, with all the flowers apparently perfect, the axes stellate-tomentose; peduncle 0.3–2 cm long, the branches 1.5–6.5 cm long; pedicels 5–6 mm long in flower, to 0.8–1.1 cm long and reflexed in fruit, slender, spaced 1–1.5 mm apart, articulated at the base.<br/>Flowers homostylous, 5-merous, odorless. Buds lance-ovoid, densely whitish tomentose. Calyx 3.5–5 mm long, the tube 2.5–3 mm, splitting more deeply in the sinuses with age, the lobes triangular-attenuate, ca. 2 × 1.5 mm, the base becoming more oblong as after splitting in the sinuses, stellate-tomentose abaxially, glabrous adaxially, unarmed, scarcely accrescent. Corolla 1.5–2 cm in diameter, 1–1.2 cm long, white, more rarely with a pale violet tinge, stellate with a narrow margin of glabrous interpetalar tissue, the lobes 9-10 x 1.5-2 cm, the midzone of the lobe linear-lanceolate, ca. 9 × 1.5 mm, finely stellate-pubescent abaxially, glabrous adaxially. Stamens free; filaments 0.7–1.3 mm long; anthers 7–8 × 0.9–1.1 mm, linear-attenuate, yellow, with minute apical pores, the pores directed distally. Ovary glabrous; style 10–12 mm, filiform, glabrous or with a few minute, simple, gland-tipped hairs near the base; stigma capitate.<br/>Fruits 0.6–0.9 cm in diameter, globose, the immature fruits green, turning bright orange, shiny, juicy, glabrous.<br/>Seeds numerous (51 seeds, <i>Nee 44599</i>; 95 seeds,<i> Nee 47092</i>), 1.7–2.2 × 1.4–1.8 mm, flattened-reniform, light yellow, the surface minutely pitted."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-acutilobum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	7ded5721-abb8-4b40-95b1-6d0fb9e15ee7#general	676bc4c4-f3ae-417c-bcf3-af34938b5a6b

wfo-0001026965	general	"Procumbent herbs, (3-)5-15 cm high. Stems herbaceous, prostrate, longitudinally ridged or narrowly winged, pubescent with long, flexuose, uniseriate, non-glandular trichomes.<br/>Sympodial units unifoliate or difoliate.<br/>Leaves simple, 1.5-4 x 0.6-2 cm, narrowly elliptical, obovate or ovate, pubescent adaxially and abaxially with abundant antrorse, simple, uniseriate trichomes; base cuneate-attenuate; margin pinnatifid to pinnatipartite, with 3-4 pairs of opposite, unequal, acute or rounded segments; apex acute; petiole 0.7-1.5 (-2.5) cm.<br/><br/>Flowers with calyx 2.5-4 mm long, the lobes 1.3-2 mm long, ca. 1.5 times longer than the tube, broadly elliptic or ovate, pubescent with eglandular trichomes similar to those of the stem mixed with glandular trichomes, the apex slightly acute; fruiting calyx papery-scarious and with evident reticulate venation, strongly latitudinally accrescent, appressed to the berry and partially covering it, the lobes 3.5-9 x 6.4-12 mm, broadly ovate. Corolla ca. 0.6 cm in diameter, 3.5-6.2 mm long, campanulate, white or violet, the lobes with non-glandular trichomes on outer surface and papillose on the margins. Free portion of the filaments 0.5-1.5 mm, with long and abundant, smooth, glandular trichomes; the filament tube 0.6-1.1 mm; anthers 1.1-1.65 x 0.7-1.1 mm, small, ellipsoidal, pale yellow, with a noticeable basal connectival dorsal prolongation (ca. 0.3 mm long), poricidal at the tips, the pores opening into longitudinal slits with age. Ovary 0.8-1.25 mm long, subglobose, glabrous; style 1.7-2 mm, articulated, cylindrical, straight, exserted, pubescent in the basal 2/3 with very short striate papillae; stigma 0.2 x 0.4 mm, capitate, wider than the style.<br/>Fruit a globose berry, (0.5-) 0.7-1 cm in diameter, multi-seeded (with 8-17 or up to 25 seeds).<br/>Seeds 1.9-2.4 x 1.5-2 mm, pale yellow, globose or trans-ovoidal, the seed coat tuberculate; embryo coiled."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-chamaesarachidium		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	cd413e6b-50b7-4746-86ff-c716eafd0856#general	678353e7-4ceb-4a86-9877-9482a0806cc6
wfo-0001030004	distribution	"<p>Common in secondary growth at high elevations in the Andes from Venezuela to northern Peru, 2000-3500 m.</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-oblongifolium		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	fbd066d9-9ced-4d78-b911-c25105d3f122#distribution	680299b2-3efc-4c69-8fff-108cd7915297
wfo-0001030004	general	"Shrubs or small trees, 2-20 m tall; young stems and leaves variously pubescent with loose, translucent dendritic trichomes ca. 1 m long; the stems thick, erect, often winged from the decurrent leaf bases; bark of older stems pale greenish-yellow.<br/>Sympodia plurifoliate, often with much axillary branching, giving the stems a bushy appearance.<br/>Leaves elliptic to obovate, often very large, especially on juvenile plants, widest at or just above the middle, the lamina glabrous adaxially or occasionally sparsely pubescent with dendritic trichomes, the pubescence dense along the veins, abaxial surface densely to sparsely pubescent (a few collections glabrous) with translucent dendritic trichomes 1-2 mm long, these denser along the veins; blades 9-30 x 4-15 cm, with 15-20 pairs of main lateral veins, these drying yellowish abaxially, the apex acute to acuminate, the base acute to sessile with the basal portion of the leaf winged onto the stem and crotaloid; petiole 0-1.5 cm long, if leaves sessile, always winged onto the stems.<br/>Inflorescence terminal, later lateral, 5-25 cm long, many times branched, up to 15 cm across, 20-200-flowered, the pubescence like that of the stems; pedicel scars unevenly spaced 1-2 mm apart. Buds globose, later obovoid, strongly exserted from the calyx tube. Pedicels at anthesis stout, erect, 0.2-1 cm long, 1-1.5 cm in diam., densely or sparsely pubescent with translucent dendritic trichomes.<br/>Flowers with the calyx tube broadly conical, 1.5-2.5 mm long, the lobes broadly deltate with a prominent knob ca. 0.3 mm from the apex, 0.3-1 mm long, densely or sparsely pubescent like the rest of the inflorescence, the apex always possessing a tuft of simple translucent trichomes; corolla white, fleshy, 1.2-2 cm in diam., lobed nearly to the base, the lobes with large thin margins, planar at anthesis, the tips and distal margins of the lobes densely papillate; anthers 3-4 mm long, 1-2 mm wide, poricidal at the tips, the pores tear-drop shaped; free portion of the filaments 0-0.5 mm long, the filament tube 0-0.5 mm long, glabrous; ovary glabrous; style stout, barely surpassing the anther cone, ca. 5 mm long; stigma capitate, the surface minutely papillose.<br/>Fruit a globose, green or yellowish-green berry, the pericarp hard and woody, 1.5-2.5 cm in diam.; fruiting pedicels woody, erect, 0.8-1.1 cm long, ca. 5 mm in diameter.<br/>Seeds pale tan, flattened-reniform with a prominent incrassate margin, 3.5-5 mm long, 3-3.5 mm wide, the body of the seed flat, the margins minutely pitted."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-oblongifolium		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	fbd066d9-9ced-4d78-b911-c25105d3f122#general	680299b2-3efc-4c69-8fff-108cd7915297

finger hairs absent; very short, gland-tipped hairs absent; prickles absent; base cuneate, obtuse, cordate or hastate, oblique part 0-4 mm long; margin entire or shallowly lobed, with obtuse basal lobes; peduncle 0-1 cm; rachis 0.5-2.5 cm; pedicels 4-6 mm long in flower, 0.5-0.7 mm thick, 0.5-1 mm thick throughout, 8-12 mm long and deflexed in fruit, 0.7-1 mm thick at mid-point, articulated at the base.<br/>Flowers homostylous, 5-merous. Calyx 2-5 mm long, the tube 1-2 mm long, the lobes 1-4 mm long, deltate, densely to very densely stellate-pubescent, the hairs white, 0.25-0.4 mm across, the stalks 0-0.1 mm long, the lateral rays 8-10, the midpoints 0.7-1.5 times as long as lateral rays, eglandular; finger hairs abundant; very short, gland-tipped hairs absent; prickles absent; fruiting calyx not to scarcely accrescent, with lobes less than half length of mature fruit, unarmed. Corolla 1.5-2 cm in diameter, 5-8 mm long, stellate, chartaceous, white, lilac, or purple, the lobes narrowly triangular, with interpetalar tissue sparse or lacking, glabrous adaxially. Stamens with filaments ca. 1 mm long; anthers 3.5-5 mm long, lanceolate, loosely connivent, yellow, the pores minute and directed distally. Ovary glabrous or with glandular hairs toward summit; style 5.5-7 mm long, cylindrical or slightly thickened upwards, straight or bent toward base, glabrous or glandular-hairy below; stigma capitate.<br/>Fruits 1-11 per inflorescence, a berry 0.7-0.8 cm in diameter, globose, red, glabrous, the mesocarp juicy, succulent.<br/>Seeds 3.5-3.8 mm long, pale yellow, thin, often twisted or bent."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-chenopodinum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	4fee42d1-0e2a-4001-aafb-39bea0059bb3#general	694b1890-d986-4cc3-8fd1-6206f555ae6c
wfo-0001027290	distribution	"<p><i>Solanum crebrispinum</i> is endemic to Queensland. It is apparently restricted to the Lake Buchanan area south of Charters Towers. It grows on sandstone ridges or “jump-ups” with <i>Eucalyptus similis, E. leichhardtii</i> or <i>Acacia shirleyi</i>. One specimen records <i>Eucalyptus brownii</i> as the dominant tree.</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-crebrispinum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	a1fc6438-57cb-4ea1-9504-a89fae74281f#distribution	69758f6e-0894-45af-9455-494697f9258f

wfo-0001030709	general	"Erect shrub, 0.7-1 m, prickly. Young stems terete, sparsely stellate-pubescent and prickly, with porrect, variously stalked trichomes, the stalks 0.1-0.2 mm long, the rays 6-8, 0.2-0.5 mm long, the midpoints ca. same length as the rays or up to 0.4 mm, the prickles 8-15 mm long, 0.3-1.5 mm wide at base, straight, conical, perpendicular to the stem, sometimes retrorse, bright red-orange, glabrous, spaced 1-6 mm apart; bark of older stems glabrescent, brown. <br/>Sympodial units plurifoliate.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades 6-21 cm long, 2-6(-9) cm wide, ca. 3 times longer than wide, elliptic, chartaceous, drying weakly discolorous, yellow-green to red-green with red-orange venation, moderately stellate-pubescent on both surfaces, with porrect stalked trichomes, the stalks 0.1-0.2 mm long, the rays 7-8, 0.15-0.5 mm long, the midpoints shorter than the rays, with 10-50 prickles on both surfaces; the primary veins 7-9 pairs, the tertiary venation usually visible abaxially but not adaxially; base cordate to truncate; margins lobed, the lobes (3-)5-9 on each side, 0.8-4 cm long, extending 2/3-3/4 of the distance to the midvein, deltate to lanceolate, often with secondary lobing, apically acute, sometimes rounded; apex acute to acuminate; petiole 1-4.5 cm long, 1/4-1/3 of the leaf blade length, sparsely stellate-pubescent, with (0-)2-8 prickles. <br/>Inflorescences apparently terminal or lateral, 5-6 cm long, not branched, with 5-10 flowers, 2-4 flowers open at any one time, moderately stellate-pubescent, with 0(-2) prickles; peduncle 5-20 mm long; pedicels 1-1.6 cm long, erect, articulated at the base, moderately stellate-pubescent, unarmed; pedicel scars spaced 2-6 mm apart. <br/>Flowers 4-5-merous, usually all perfect, occasionally with a few short-styled flowers at the inflorescence apex. Calyx 8-11 mm long, moderately stellate-pubescent, with 0-20 prickles, the lobes ca. 5 mm long, narrow-deltate, apically long-acuminate. Corolla 2.3-3 cm in diameter, mauve to purple, stellate, lobed for 1/3-1/2 of the way to the base, the lobes 5-7 mm long, 6-10 mm wide, broad-deltate, apically cuspidate, spreading, sparsely stellate-pubescent abaxially, the trichomes porrect, stalked, the stalks 0.1-0.2 mm, the rays 6-8, 0.2-0.5 mm long, the midpoints ca. same length as the rays or to 0.4 mm long. Stamens equal, with the filament tube ca. 2 mm long, the free portion of the filaments ca. 1 mm long; anthers 6-7 mm long, connivent, tapering, poricidal at the tips. Ovary stellate-pubescent in the upper 1/4; style 1.3-1.4 cm long, slender, almost straight, moderately stellate-pubescent for most of its length. <br/>Fruit a spherical berry, 2-5 per infructescence, 1-1.2 cm in diameter, the pericarp smooth, yellow at maturity, glabrous; fruiting pedicels 1.4-2 cm long, 0.9-1.5 mm in diameter at base, woody, pendulous, with 0(-5) prickles; fruiting calyx lobes elongating to 10-14 mm long, 1/2-2/3 the length of the mature fruit, reflexed with 0-20 prickles. <br/>Seeds ca. 20-30 per berry, 1.9-2.8 mm long, 1.6-2.1 mm wide, flattened-reniform, dull yellow to orange-brown, the surface finely pitted, the middle of seed almost smooth, the pit size increasing towards the edges of the seed."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-pyracanthos		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	e2ff5bc1-b837-4a79-b522-fe2ca63dc918#general	6a15b0a8-d988-4e62-a9da-285fffdde8e2

wfo-0001028182	general	"Spindly shrubs or hemiepiphytes, branches ca. 1 m long; young stems and leaves sparsely pubescent with lax uniseriate simple trichomes 0.5-1 mm long, these sparser but still present on older branches; the branches arching and slender; bark of older stems grey.<br/>Sympodial units unifoliate.<br/>Leaves narrowly ovate, widest in the proximal third of the blade, shiny above, with uniseriate trichomes like those of the stems along the midrib, glabrous beneath, the blades 6-9 x 2-2.5 cm, with 4-6 pairs of main lateral veins, these not prominent above, except the keeled midrib, prominent and brown below (dry specimens), the apex long-acuminate, ciliate, the extreme tip rounded, the base truncate, somewhat cordate; petioles minute, 1-1.5 mm long, sparsely pubescent with uniseriate trichomes like those of the stems.<br/>Inflorescences opposite the leaves or internodal, filiform and simple, 2-6.5 cm long, zig-zag at the pedicel scars, 5-15-flowered, with only 2 or 3 flowers on the inflorescence at a time, sparsely pubescent with simple, uniseriate trichomes 0.5-1 mm long; pedicel scars evenly spaced ca. 5 mm apart, the axis of the inflorescence bending ca. 80-90 at each scar. Buds globose when young, later ellipsoid or obovoid, sparsely pubescent with the uniseriate trichomes. Pedicels at anthesis filiform, purplish, deflexed, 0.9-1 cm long, tapering from the calyx tube to a slender base less than 0.5 mm in diam.<br/>Flowers with the calyx tube conical, 1-1.5 mm long, strongly 5-ribbed, the ribs black in dry material, sparsely pubescent with uniseriate simple trichomes ca. 0.5 mm long, the lobes deltoid, apiculate, 0.5-1 mm long, sparsely pubescent with the trichomes like those of the tube, the tips of the apiculae densely papillose; corolla white, 0.8-1 cm in diam., lobed nearly to the base, the lobes planar or slightly reflexed at anthesis, the tips and margins of the lobes minutely papillose; anthers 2-2.5 x ca. 1 mm, poricidal at the tips, the pores tear-drop shaped; free portion of the filaments 0.5-0.6 mm long, the filament tube 0.1-0.2 mm long; ovary glabrous; style 3-5 mm long; stigma capitate, the surface minutely papillose.<br/>Fruit not known.<br/>Seeds not known."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-gonyrhachis		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	a041d636-1321-4eab-aa81-de93476414cb#general	6a3f8ff7-59bd-464a-ae0b-78bfa39074d0
wfo-0001028788	distribution	"<p><i>Solanum jucundum</i> is widely distributed in Queensland and into New South Wales, Australia, In Queensland it occurs south of the Tropic of Capricorn, especially in the western Darling Downs and Maranoa districts. It also extends to central-western New South Wales, as far south as Peak Hill. It inhabits stony or sandy ridges in shrubby eucalypt woodland; the dominant species often include <i>Eucalyptus crebra, E. citriodora, E. melanophloia</i> or <i>Acacia catenulata</i>.</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-jucundum		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	3118f9b1-85dc-418c-9653-0bc95b3727eb#distribution	6a974b7f-2d51-46fb-9210-5d66141faff0

wfo-0001026367	general	"Shrubs 1–2 m high, spreadingly branched, the internodes usually short, 1–3 cm long. Stems with pubescence close and dense, some­what tawny, of interwoven short stalked and sessile porrect stellae, the stalks to 0.2–0.5 mm long, the rays 6–8, 0.4–0.6 mm long, spreading or weakly ascending, the midpoints a little shorter; stems unarmed or sparsely armed with prickles 3–6 mm long, acicular, spreading.<br/>Sympodia plurifoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades 10–15 (–20) × 3–7 cm, ca. 2.5 times as long as wide, lance ovate to ovate, thick-chartaceous, green and densely stellate tomentose adaxially, more loosely tomentose and lighter colored abaxially, the stellae of both leaf surfaces mostly short stalked, some sessile, similar to those of the stem, but those of the abaxial surface slightly larger and much denser than those of the adaxial surface, the blade usually unarmed, or with a few acicular prickles near base of midvein; 7–11 principal lateral veins on each side of midvein; base rounded or weakly cordate; margin usually entire on later growth, or irregularly and very shallowly sinuately lobed; apex acuminate; petioles 1–3 cm, stellate tomentose, unarmed or sparsely armed with prickles like those of the stem.<br/>Inflorescences 3–7 cm in flower, slightly longer in fruit, initially terminal, soon overtopped and lateral, 2–5-branched, with 15–30 flowers, with all flowers apparently perfect,<strong> </strong>the axes stellate-tomentose with hairs often somewhat denser and more farinose or looser than those of the stem, some of the stellae longer stalked, to 0.4–0.7 mm, unarmed; peduncle 1–3 cm and erect in flower, the branches 2–3.5 cm; pedicels 10–18 mm, closely spaced 2–3 mm apart, articulated at the base.<br/>Flowers homostylous, 5-merous. Buds broadly ovoid, densely stellate tomentose. Calyx 5–9 mm long, the tube 2.5–4 mm, often splitting more deeply in the sinuses with age, the lobes 2–4 × 2–3 mm, narrowly deltoid, in age often oblong with a caudate tip, stellate tomentose abaxially, glabrous adaxially. Corolla 2–4.5 cm in diameter, 15-20 mm long, rotate pentagonal with well-developed glabrous interpetalar tissue, lavender or blue, the midzone ca. 4 mm wide, the tube 7-9.7 mm, the lobes ca. 5 × 10 mm, broadly triangular, acute at apices, densely and finely stellate-tomentose abaxially, sparsely stellate-pubescent adaxially with very small stellae along the center of the midvein. Stamens with filaments 1–2 mm, glabrous; anthers 5–7.5 × 1.2-1.6 mm, weakly attenuate, yellow, the pores directed distally and slightly adaxially. Ovary densely stellate pubescent; style 8–10 × 0.5–0.7 mm, filiform, stellate pubescent at base, glabrous at apex; stigma capitate.<br/>Fruits 0.7–1.5 cm in diameter, globose, the immature fruits green, turning yellow, eventually black-brown when dried, stellate pubescent when immature but glabrate at maturity.<br/>Seeds 3–4 × 1.8–2.5 mm, plump lenticular, broadly asymmetric ovate, yellow to tan, the surface minutely pitted."		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-asteropilodes		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	2508f949-1f13-46c0-b7ed-9e70a92d1d92#general	6ab0e642-82ac-47b2-8956-f518c7d29d7e
wfo-0001029662	distribution	"<p>The few collections to date show <i>Solanum moxosense</i> is adapted to weedy or disturbed areas around cattle pens, but the original adaptation is probably to natural disturbances of the seasonally inundated savanna in which Trinidad, Bolivia is situated. So far it is only known from the immediate vicinity of the city at ca. 200 m in elevation. It is a weed in the city of Trinidad and was also seen commonly on dirt roads and near cattle yards near Puerto Almacén, 7 km SW of the city, but not yet blooming there, so no specimens were collected. No collections have been seen from the Estación Biológica del Beni, ca. 150 km to the west, one of the few areas of the Beni plains that has been thoroughly explored botanically.</p>"		http://solanaceaesource.org/content/solanum-moxosense		Solanaceae Source	eng	http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution	text/html	http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text	4370f824-74f6-4245-841d-2954ff554e63	http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/	14f706a6-11f1-4e6a-89dc-02dbc21653ba#distribution	6b2e45a1-f47f-40c4-9636-6684f57e100a
wfo-0001029662	general	"Herb or vine, creeping and rooting at the nodes, or some stems erect, to 20 cm tall. Stems slender, to ca. 2.5 mm in diameter, nearly glabrous to sparsely pilose with simple, 2–3-celled hairs, sparsely armed with prickles 1.7–3.5 mm long, slightly reflexed, nearly straight or slightly curved.<br/>Sympodial units 2- to 3-foliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves simple, the blades 5–7.5 x 3.5–6 cm, more or less uniform in size and shape, ovate, chartaceous, glabrous adaxially, very sparsely pubescent abaxially with sessile 4-rayed stellae 0.7–1 mm wide, the midpoints shorter than the lateral rays, sparsely armed above and below with straight acicular prickles 1–3.5 mm long on the major veins; base truncate to subcordate, nearly equal to very unequal and with one side offset by up to 1 cm from the other; margin repand to shallowly lobed with 3–4 rounded to obtuse lobes per side; apex obtuse; petioles 0.7–3 cm, with hairs and prickles like those of the stems.<br/>Inflorescences 5-6 cm, extra-axillary or opposite the leaves, unbranched, with 4–5 flowers, the plants probably andromonecious and only the lowest one or two flowers fertile, the axes nearly glabrous to sparsely pilose with simple or stellate hairs and with 1 or 2 acicular prickles ca. 2 mm long; peduncle 3–4 cm; rachis ca. 2 cm; pedicels 9–11 mm in flower, to 15 mm and somewhat thickened in fruit, expanded distally to 1.5 mm in diameter, recurved, widely spaced 7-14 mm apart, articulated at the base.<br/>Flowers perhaps lightly fragrant, with the calyx campanulate, 6-7 mm long, the tube 2–3 mm, the lobes ca. 4 x 1.4 mm including the ca. 1 mm long caudate tip, oblong-ovate, with a few sessile stellate hairs, unarmed; fruiting calyx somewhat accrescent, the lobes to ca. 6.5 x 3.2 mm. wfo-0001029332	general	"Erect to scandent shrub to 2 m, prickly. Young stems terete, densely stellate-pubescent and prickly, with porrect, sessile or variously stalked trichomes, the stalks to 0.1 mm long, the rays 6-8, 0.1-0.2 mm long, the midpoints same length as the rays or shorter, often reduced to globular glands, the prickles 1-3 mm long, 1-1.5 mm wide at base, curved, conical to flattened, pale yellow to orange-brown, stellate pubescent in the lower 1/3, spaced 4-15 mm apart; bark of older stems glabrescent, grayish. <br/>Sympodial units difoliate, not geminate. <br/>Leaves simple, the blades 6-8 cm long, 3-6 cm wide, ca. 1.5 times longer than wide, ovate, chartaceous, drying concolorous, yellow-green to yellow-orange; adaxial surface glabrescent; abaxial surface densely stellate-pubescent, with porrect, subsessile trichomes, the stalks less than 0.1 mm long, the rays ca. 8, 0.15-0.2 mm long, the midpoints same length as the rays or shorter, with 0-5 prickles on both surfaces; the primary veins 5-6 pairs, the tertiary venation visible on both surfaces; base cordate; margins weakly lobed, the lobes 2-4 on each side, 0-0.5 cm long, extending to 1/4 of the distance to the midvein, broad-deltate, apically rounded; apex rounded; petiole 1.5-2 cm long, 1/4-1/3 of the leaf blade length, densely stellate-pubescent, with 0-4 prickles. <br/>Inflorescences apparently terminal or lateral, 3-4 cm long, unbranched, with 4-10 flowers, 2-4 flowers open at any one time, moderately stellate-pubescent, with 0-5 prickles; peduncle 1-4 mm long; pedicels 0.5-1 cm long, erect, articulated at the base, moderately stellate-pubescent, with 0-2 prickles; pedicel scars spaced 2-4 mm apart.<br/>Flowers 5-merous, heterostylous and the plants andromonoecious, with the lowermost 1-4 flowers long-styled and hermaphrodite, the distal flowers short-styled and staminate. wfo-0001026441	general	"Herbs 0.3-0.7 m tall, semierect to erect. Stems up to 10 mm in diameter at base of plant, green to green mottled with purple, with straight narrow wings to 0.8 mm, usually glabrous; tubers typically placed one at the end of each stolon.<br/>Sympodial units tri- to plurifoliate, not geminate.<br/>Leaves odd-pinnate, the blades 7-20 x 4-8.5 cm, chartaceous, glabrous to sparsely pubescent adaxially and abaxially, with hairs like those of the stems; lateral leaflet pairs 3-5, subequal or decreasing in size gradually toward the leaf base, with the terminal leaflet equal to or slightly larger than the laterals; most distal lateral leaflets 2-5.5 x 0.5-1.5 cm, ovate to elliptic-lanceolate, the apex slightly acuminate, the base with long petiolules 6-15 mm, symmetrical; terminal leaflet 4-6 x 1.5-2.5 cm, elliptic-lanceolate, the apex short acuminate, the base rounded or obtuse, with secondary leaflets on the petiolule absent; interjected leaflets 0-2, subsessile, ovate to orbicular; petioles 2-8 cm, glabrous.
